body:
**If this issue affects you, please react with a üëç (thumbs up emoji) to the initial post.**

Your feedback helps us prioritize which bugs to investigate and address first.

![Views](https://api.views-badge.org/badge/st-issue-9570)

performed_via_github_app.name: GitHub Actions
performed_via_github_app.description: Automate your workflow from idea to production

body:
Index columns can be addressed via `_index` in column config. You can use that to disable editing:

```python
st.data_editor(
    df_string_index, column_config={"_index": st.column_config.Column(disabled=True)}
)
```

or 

```python
st.data_editor(df_string_index, disabled=["_index"])
```

Does that work for your usecase? 

It is a bit of a hidden feature, and we should probably explain this better in the documentation. At the moment, only range indices have a special treatment (enforced as non-editable). We could potentially make non-editable the default behavior, but that might be a breaking change.

This is exactly what I was looking for! I kinda hoped, that this is simply a hidden feature missing in the documentation.

Are you planning on adding this to the documentation?
cc @sfc-gh-dmatthews  maybe we can explicitly mention `_index` in the `disabled` docstring?

I have it in the `column_config` parameter of `st.dataframe` and `st.data_editor`: It seems a little odd to try and special-case a parameter within each configuration to repeat it (because "use _index" is just a general rule that applies the entirety of the configuration. Maybe I could update the description of each Column type to circularly reference back to the fact that it's a value in a dictionary passed to `column_config`. It seems a little awkward, but if a lot of people are missing it, I can understand... I also have an index example in `st.dataframe`: I don't think it's explicitly covered in the dataframe concept/guide, so it would make sense to add a mention there and help with search/discoverability.

issue.title: Clarify column configuration: positional index references and index columns

repository.name: streamlit
repository.description: Streamlit ‚Äî A faster way to build and share data apps.

issue.body:
## Describe your changes
Add support for positional column indices and clarify configuration of index columns.

## GitHub Issue Link (if applicable)
Closes #9570

body:
@sfc-gh-dmatthews I somehow missed the information in the documentation, but I believe that your changes will make it a lot clearer to most people looking for this information.

Thank you!
